description: Dated from the 14th century C.E. as Middle English collusioun, collusion; from Old French collusion, from Latin collusio (“act of colluding”).

entries.meaning: A secret agreement for an illegal purpose; conspiracy.
examples: Such tunges unhappy hath made great diviſionIn realmes, in cities, by ſuche fals abuſion;Of fals fickil tunges ſuche cloked colluſionHath brought nobil princes to extreme confuſion.
